messages.message:
Seeing this error when opening this refiner (https://instabase.com/apps/refiner-v5/edit/SA_team/demo_new/fs/Instabase%20Drive/Docs/Memorandum%20of%20Assosciation/refiner/memorandum_of_assosciation.ibrefiner) on instabase.com (http://instabase.com).
It was previously working fine, without this error.

Should i be reporting this in an internal Zendesk ticket (are we using it for internal bugs?), or in a Jira ticket, or is reporting it here just fine?
<!subteam^S01DXHX6FPT> @Heymian This seems similar to what JPMC has seen initially?
@Matt Weaver Do you know roughly when this happened? That'd be helpful for us to inspect the logs
it happened at the time i shared this post

just to add to this we have users around similar time (~3:30am ET) also reporting similar errors writing files from a flow step / app tasks (refiner script loading is also using app tasks if i remember correctly)
https://instabase.slack.com/archives/CV8V33RPV/p1630395812070200?thread_ts=1630316906.050600&cid=CV8V33RPV
can someone from <!subteam^S01DXHX6FPT> take a look? users reported errors both today and yesterday on prod

I clicked open the Refiner link in Mattâ€™s original message, the scripts are loading fine for me now, but i notice is that file loading seems to be very slow on prod - it took ~5 seconds to load the initial refiner program, and `loading records` seems to run forever. @lydia - is this the normal speed for refiner, or is this slower than expected? i waited like 15 seconds for 5 records to load, a record is < 10 pages
